p: There are multiple strategies proposed to restore immune function in the elderly [ 52], and multiple databases of geroprotectors exist [ 53, 54]. However, to date the only known geroprotectors backed by promising clinical evidence of improved immune response to viral infection in the elderly, although still limited by a lack of large clinical trials, are sirolimus (rapamycin) and everolimus. These may be used as single agents in combination with other treatments ( Figure 3).
